means: Children Requiring a Caring Community 儿童需要一个有同情心的社会

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"打破，弄碎"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: break, burst, crack, crush, fracture, shatter, smash
means: break ： 常用词，含义广泛，多指猛然用力将坚硬物打破或损坏。
burst ： 指某物因内部外部压力过大而出现严重破裂、爆开或账破。
crack ： 多指因长期使用或经受压力，物体表现呈现裂纹、裂口或破裂、裂开，但一般没成碎片。
crush ： 指用力把东西压破或变形。
fracture ： 比crack的破裂程度更深更严重，常指断裂，医学上指骨折。
shatter ： 指破裂为许多支离破碎的碎片，多用指易碎事物。
smash ： 指突然而猛烈地重击某物，使之破碎或完全变形。

sentence.Network_en: She's calm and strong, and she is just not going to crack.
sentence.Network_cn: 她镇定而且坚强，绝不会垮掉。

sentence.Network_en: In severe cases, the skin can crack and weep.
sentence.Network_cn: 在恶劣的条件下，皮肤可能会开裂并流脓。

sentence.Network_en: Drug experts say it could spell the end of the crack epidemic.
sentence.Network_cn: 禁毒专家说它可能会结束强效可卡因吸食泛滥的局面。

open a bottle, especially of wine, and drink it

a thunder peal announcing the Day of Judgement
(Brit. informal)a chance to try one's hand at or participate in something

lj.lj_ly: individuals who feel that they have not had a fair crack of the whip.
lj.lj_ls: 感觉没有公平机会的个人。

jx.jx_en_mean: [with negative](informal)asserted to be (used to indicate that someone or something has been described too favourably)

lj.lj_ly: life on tour is not as glamorous as it's cracked up to be.
lj.lj_ls: 旅行生活并不像所吹嘘的那样迷人。

jx.jx_en_mean: To act more forcefully to regulate, repress, or restrain
jx.jx_cn_mean: 严厉取缔：采取严厉措施来规定、抑制或约束

lj.lj_ly: The police cracked down on speeding.
most tickets have been snapped up, so get cracking if you want one.
lj.lj_ls: 大部分票都被一抢而空了，想要的话得赶快行动了。

jx.jx_en_mean: (N. Amer.). another way of saying slip through the net (see net)
jx.jx_cn_mean: (北美)。 同 slip through the net （见 net）
(非正式)采取严厉措施；严厉打击

lj.lj_ly: we need to crack down hard on workplaces that break safety regulations.
lj.lj_ls: 我们必须严惩不守安全规则的工场。

lj.lj_ly: we'll &B{crack on with} the second half of the job this month.
lj.lj_ls: 这个月我们要加快下半部分工作的进程。

lj.lj_ly: He was simply not the genius he was cracked up to be.
lj.lj_ls: 他不象人们所赞扬的那样是个天才

jx.jx_en_mean: To damage or wreck (a vehicle or vessel)

lj.lj_ly: crack up a plane; crack up a boat.

jx.jx_en_mean: To have a mental or physical breakdown.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 崩溃：在精神上或体力上的崩溃

jx.jx_en_mean: To experience or cause to experience a great deal of amusement
jx.jx_cn_mean: 大笑：经历或使经历极大的快乐

lj.lj_ly: really cracked up when I heard that joke.
lj.lj_ls: 听到那个笑话我真想大笑

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English cracian 'make an explosive noise'; of Germanic origin; related to Dutch kraken and German krachen

entry.def: If something hard cracks, or if you crack it, it becomes slightly damaged, with lines appearing on its surface.

example.ex: A gas main had cracked under my neighbour's garage and gas had seeped into our homes...
example.tran: 邻居车库下面的煤气总管裂开了，煤气渗入了我们家。

example.ex: Remove the dish from the oven, crack the salt crust and you will find the skin just peels off the fish.
example.tran: 把盘子从烤箱里拿出来，弄碎鱼表面的那层盐，鱼皮就会从鱼身上剥落下来了。

entry.def: If something cracks, or if you crack it, it makes a sharp sound like the sound of a piece of wood breaking.

example.ex: Thunder cracked in the sky...
example.tran: 空中雷声咔嚓作响。

example.ex: He cracked his fingers nervously.
example.tran: 他紧张不安地把手指按得咔吧作响。

entry.def: If you crack a hard part of your body, such as your knee or your head, you hurt it by accidentally hitting it hard against something.

example.ex: He cracked his head on the pavement and was knocked cold.
example.tran: 他一头撞到人行道上，不省人事了。

entry.def: When you crack something that has a shell, such as an egg or a nut, you break the shell in order to reach the inside part.

example.ex: Crack the eggs into a bowl.
example.tran: 把鸡蛋打在一个碗中。

entry.tran: (尤指经过反复思考)找到…的解决办法，破译(密码)
entry.def: If you crack a problem or a code, you solve it, especially after a lot of thought.

example.ex: He has finally cracked the system after years of painstaking research.
example.tran: 经过多年的努力研究，他终于找到了破解这个系统的办法。

entry.def: If someone cracks, they lose control of their emotions or actions because they are under a lot of pressure.

example.ex: She's calm and strong, and she is just not going to crack...
example.tran: 她镇定而且坚强，绝不会垮掉。

example.ex: I had the conviction Larkin's nerve would crack and he'd squeeze the trigger in a reflex action...
example.tran: 我确信拉金会神经崩溃，他会反射性地扣动扳机。

entry.tran: (因感情强烈而嗓音)变嘶哑，变沙哑
entry.def: If your voice cracks when you are speaking or singing, it changes in pitch because you are feeling a strong emotion.

example.ex: Her voice cracked and she began to cry.
example.tran: 她的声音变得沙哑，继而哭了起来。

entry.def: If you crack a joke, you tell it.

example.ex: He cracked jokes and talked about beer and girls.
example.tran: 他爱说笑话，喜欢谈论啤酒和姑娘。

entry.def: If you say that something is not all it's cracked up to be, you mean that it is not as good as other people have said it is.

example.ex: Package holidays are not always all they're cracked up to be.
example.tran: 全包旅游并不总像人们说的那么好。

entry.def: A crack is a very narrow gap between two things, or between two parts of a thing.

example.ex: Kathryn had seen him through a crack in the curtains.
example.tran: 凯瑟琳透过窗帘缝看见了他。

entry.def: If you open something such as a door, window, or curtain a crack, you open it only a small amount.

example.ex: He went to the door, opened it a crack, and listened.
example.tran: 他朝门走去，打开一条门缝听着。

entry.def: A crack is a line that appears on the surface of something when it is slightly damaged.

example.ex: The plate had a crack in it...
example.tran: 盘子上有一道裂纹。

example.ex: Hundreds of office buildings and homes developed large cracks in walls and ceilings.
example.tran: 数百栋写字楼和住宅楼的墙壁和天花板上都出现了裂缝。

entry.def: A crack is a sharp sound, like the sound of a piece of wood breaking.

example.ex: Suddenly there was a loud crack and glass flew into the car...
example.tran: 突然发出一声巨大的爆裂声，玻璃碎片飞进了车里。

example.ex: 'Crack!' — The first shot rang out, hitting Paolo.
example.tran: “砰！”第一声枪响了，打中了保罗。

entry.def: If you have or take a crack at something, you make an attempt to do or achieve something.

example.ex: I should love to have a crack at the Olympia title in my last year...
example.tran: 我非常愿意在我职业生涯的最后一年向奥林匹亚大赛冠军头衔发起冲击。

example.ex: She decided to head for the dormitory to take another crack at locating Blanche.
example.tran: 她决定回宿舍再找找布兰奇。

entry.tran: (略显粗鲁或刻薄的)笑话，俏皮话
entry.def: A crack is a slightly rude or cruel joke.

example.ex: When Paul made the crack about the 'famous girl detective', I began to suspect that he had it in for you.
example.tran: 当保罗挖苦你是“著名的女侦探”时，我开始怀疑他是不是故意刁难你。

entry.tran: 强效可卡因;强力古柯碱
entry.def: Crack is a very pure form of the drug cocaine.

entry.tran: (士兵或运动员)训练有素的，一流的
entry.def: A crack soldier or sportsman is highly trained and very skilful.

example.ex: ...a crack undercover police officer...
example.tran: 训练有素的便衣警察

example.ex: He is said to be a crack shot, despite weak vision in one eye.
example.tran: 尽管一只眼视力较弱，他仍被称为神枪手。

entry.def: If you say that someone does something at the crack of dawn, you are emphasizing that they do it very early in the morning.

example.ex: I often start work at the crack of dawn when there is a big order to get out.
example.tran: 有大笔订单要处理时，我经常会清晨便开始工作。

entry.def: If you paper over the cracks, you try to hide all the things that are wrong with something.

example.ex: The meeting was stormy, and the two sides managed only to paper over the cracks on some issues.
example.tran: 会议很激烈，但双方只是在试图掩盖某些问题上的错误。

entry.tran: 合理的机会;均等的机会
entry.def: If you get a fair crack of the whip, you are allowed a reasonable opportunity to succeed at something.

example.ex: None of them is expecting any favours, just a fair crack of the whip.
example.tran: 他们谁也不期望受到任何特殊照顾，只希望机会均等。

means.word_mean: 3. a long narrow depression in a surface

sentences.sentence: "he heard the cracking of the ice"
"he can hear the snap of a twig"
"he wanted a shot at the champion"

means.word_mean: 7. a blemish resulting from a break without complete separation of the parts;

sentences.sentence: "there was a crack in the mirror"

means.word_mean: 8. a purified and potent form of cocaine that is smoked rather than snorted
1. become fractured; break or crack on the surface only;

sentences.sentence: "The glass cracked when it was heated"

means.word_mean: 2. make a very sharp explosive sound;
4. hit forcefully; deal a hard blow, making a cracking noise;

sentences.sentence: "The teacher cracked him across the face with a ruler"
"Registrations cracked through the 30,000 mark in the county"

means.word_mean: 6. break partially but keep its integrity;
7. break suddenly and abruptly, as under tension;

sentences.sentence: "heat and light cracked the back of the leather chair"

means.word_mean: 11. reduce (petroleum) to a simpler compound by cracking
12. break into simpler molecules by means of heat;

list.explanation: 难打交道的或难以理解的人或事，难以办到的事

example.en: I wish Jill wasn't such a tough nut to crack.
example.zh: 我希望吉尔不是个那么难打交道的人。

example.en: This problem is a tough egg to crack.
example.zh: 这一问题可真令人难以理解。

example.en: Getting them all here on time will be a tough nul to crack.
example.zh: 要他们全都准时到将是件很难办到的事。

auth_sentence.content: We need to crack on rather than mope about.
auth_sentence.res_content: We need to crack on rather than mope about.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We need to crack on rather than mope about.

auth_sentence.content: Let commercial continue to take a crack at LEO.
auth_sentence.res_content: Let commercial continue to take a crack at LEO.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Let commercial continue to take a crack at LEO.

auth_sentence.content: We have nuclear weapons that could crack the Earth.
auth_sentence.res_content: We have nuclear weapons that could crack the Earth.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We have nuclear weapons that could crack the Earth.

stems_affixes.word_buile: crack破,爆裂→n.裂缝, 噼啪声 v.[使]破裂,爆裂

stems_affixes.value_cn: 饼干, 爆竹;破解高手
stems_affixes.word_buile: crack破,爆裂+er人或物→n.饼干, 爆竹;破解高手
crack破,爆裂→n.裂缝, 噼啪声 v.[使]破裂,爆裂

Sentence.sentence: Houses built before 1939 use about 50% more energy per square foot than those built after 2000, mainly due to the tiny cracks and gaps that expand over time and let in more outside air.
Three year students get first crack at course registration.

sentences.en: But at last the shells cracked, one after another.
sentences.cn: 最后, 蛋壳一个接着一个地裂开了。

sentences.en: You can crack this toughened glass, but you can't break it.
sentences.cn: 这种韧化玻璃只裂不碎。
父亲正在砸开那些坚果。
鞭子挥得噼啪响得惊人。

sentences.en: He cracked the joints of his fingers.
sentences.cn: 他把手指关节弄得劈啪作响。

sentences.en: There's a crack in this cup.
He heard the sharp crack of a twig.
sentences.cn: 他听到树枝清脆的断裂声。

sentences.en: I got a nasty crack on the head when I went through that low door.
sentences.cn: 我走过那扇矮门时, 把头给撞了一下。

sentences.en: I've never done this before, but I'll have a crack.
sentences.cn: 我以前从未做过这个, 不过我将试试看。

sentences.en: He's always making cracks about my big feet.
sentences.cn: 他总是拿我的一双大脚开玩笑。

sentences.en: She cracked the window to let in fresh air.
sentences.cn: 她稍微打开了一点窗户，让新鲜空气进入室内。

sentences.en: Inside the reactor the large molecules are cracked into smaller molecules.
sentences.cn: 在反应堆内部大的分子被裂解为较小的分子。

sentences.en: The shirt wasn't all the salesclerk cracked it up to be.
sentences.cn: 这件衬衫并不全像售货员所吹嘘的那么好。

jushi.english: The ice cracked as I stepped onto it.
His health cracked under the strain.
jushi.chinese: 他的身体因过度劳累而垮下来了。

jushi.english: A bullet cracked past his ear, and the dogs were upon him.
jushi.chinese: 一颗子弹擦耳而过,接着那些狗就扑到他的身上。
